New Records: Virat Kohli is one run short of equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record for the most ODI centuries.
Marco Jansen has picked up 12 wickets in the powerplay, the most by any bowler in this World Cup.
South Africa's 82 sixes in the tournament are the most by any team in a single edition of the World Cup.
Key Match Events: India won the match by 243 runs after South Africa were dismissed for 83 runs.
Lungi Ngidi dismissed Shreyas Iyer four times in 30 balls in ODIs.
Pre-Game Insights: The toss conundrum: India prefer chasing while South Africa prefer batting first.
Dew could play a role in the second innings due to evening temperatures.
Post-Match Reflections: India head coach Rahul Dravid emphasized the pressure moments ahead.
South Africa captain Temba Bavuma highlighted the need to deal with pressure.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch at Eden Gardens hasn't favored a particular type of bowling.
Virat Kohli's approach against spinners in the World Cup is notable.
Others: South Africa's form and India's strategy with a five-bowler approach were discussed.
Mohammed Shami's impact despite not being in the initial XI was noted.
